info.name: POS API Documentation
info.description:
URL - [https://dev-pos-api.zithara.com](https://dev-pos-api.zithara.com/v1)

> **Fields that are present in the request body are mandatory** 
  
> **This API also Accepts additional fields that are present in the response**

request.description:
### Response Body

``` json
{
    "access_token": "eyJraWQiOiJONm5qZVhqak4xNDFuelBDeEZLOFZDZWtMQlNOT1JvaGpjXC8yYVF4cTlpaz0iLCJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiJ9..uTBNLVWepVs6esx1nNwr6AlkwKuKZHEqe2tm0NvYf-PNeGqTgGk7VuT204jCJ67KrC6L5YiO61MHwFcc9HQMEGZfM7LhdYuw0vDGmjfA-AOnZc-QX5GC4uOmGO_H-SjoUEXfi8sHm4KkTMI3M1TrhoQ1Yz_othyPJcINjsNA0MQ34_RpDdCa6NcqAc_Fy-Zu6dyu9VsPp1Sb-daOtB-96sw8kEbXrNLq-GVRitG4OqWUmEzfgkB3FB4ovB0w313XVpaeHhLGyEa4avY3d7rREKHllEr4cgStyZaT7DyhY9RFRWOgZUaHiiiIGfzlnKCPCJU5ji0zA48eqFTfHeiLrw",
    "expires_in": 3600,
    "token_type": "Bearer"
}

 ```

This JSON represents the response body containing an access token with its expiration time and token type.

### Response Body

``` json
{
    "message": "We are live."
}

 ```

This JSON represents the response body with a message indicating "We are live."

## Endpoint

### Create Single Customer

### POST `/v1/customer`

- Create Customer
    
- if the customer exists - updates the customer
    
- Adds a default amount of points if a customer is created

### Get Single Customer

This API endpoint allows you to retrieve details of a single customer based on various query parameters such as `customer_id`, `platformCustomerId`, `email`, or `phone`. Send any field in the query params

## Endpoint

### GET`/v1/customer`

Retrieves details of a single customer based on query parameters.

### Request

- Method: `GET`
    
- Query Parameters
    
- `customerId`: Customer ID
    
- `platformCustomerId`: Platform Customer ID
    
- `email`: Customer's email address
    
- `phone`: Customer's phone number  
    Example query:
    

[https://dev-pos-api.zithara.com/v1/customer?](https://dev-pos-api.zithara.com/v1/customer?id=12304)customer[Id=12304](https://dev-pos-api.zithara.com/v1/customer?id=12304)

### Response

A successful response returns a JSON object with customer details.

#### Sample Response

``` json
{
    "id": "134034",
    "name": "Dileep Bez",
    "first_name": "Dileep updated",
    "last_name": "Dileep Bez",
    "email": "",
    "phone_number": "917275724262",
    "whatsapp_phone_number": "917275724262",
    "additional_emails": null,
    "additional_phone_numbers": null,
    "points": "0",
    "referral_code": null,
    "referred_by": null,
    "merchant_id": "35221b02-c600-46f7-bcab-549f399c2a8d",
    "sub_merchant_id": "535108e9-6ad7-47a5-9861-1e96cf654ec0",
    "created_at": "2024-06-23T17:39:12.543Z",
    "updated_at": "2024-06-23T19:55:47.429Z",
    "user_id": null,
    "customer_state": "lead",
    "external_customer_id": null,
    "occupations": null,
    "profile_pic": null,
    "facebook_id": null,
    "instagram_id": null,
    "whatsapp_id": null,
    "shopify_id": null,
    "instagram_profile_id": null,
    "instagram_profile_pic": null,
    "facebook_profile_pic": null,
    "custom_attributes": {},
    "employee_id": null,
    "manager_id": null,
    "platform_customer_id": "jdfsf"
}

 ```

## Endpoint

### Get Customers

### GET`/v1/customers`

- `page` - optional
    
- `pageSize` - optional

request.description:
## Endpoint

### GET `/v1/order/{PLATFORM_ORDER_ID}`

Retrieves an order along with its order line items.

**URL:** `http://dev-pos-api.zithara.com/v1/order/{PLATFORM_ORDER_ID}`

- `{PLATFORM_ORDER_ID}`: The unique ID of the order on the platform. **Required.**
    

Here's the JSON response formatted:

``` json
[
    {
        "id": "235",
        "created_at": "2024-06-20T14:14:11.000Z",
        "currency": "INR",
        "current_subtotal_price": "5000.00",
        "current_total_discounts": "0.00",
        "current_total_price": "5000.00",
        "current_total_tax": "0.00",

        "name": "RKM/2200",
        "note": "false",

        "sub_merchant_id": "35221b02-c600-46f7-bcab-549f399c2a8d",
        "platform_order_id": "9g4s435ttfffhfdhkkyf337",

                "status": "paid",
                "platform_transaction_id": "Or4345 -54fffhfkhttsdhf01-0017"
            }
        ],
 ```

request.description:
## Endpoint

### POST `/v1/order`

Creates a new order with the specified details.

**URL:** `https://dev-pos-api.zithara.com/v1/order`

- Adds a default amount of points for single transaction
    

## Request Body

The request body must be a JSON object with the following structure:

``` json
{
    "customer": {
        "platform_customer_id": "hyyfsdg",
        "first_name": "Dileep updated",
          "phone_number": "919886668886",
        "last_name": "Dileep Bez",
        "name": "Dileep Bez",
        "whatsapp_phone_number": "917275724262",
        "custom_attributes": {}
    },
    "order_line_item": [
        {
 ```

# Customer Orders

## Endpoint

### GET `/v1/customer/order/{PLATFORM_CUSTOMER_ID}`

Retrieves the orders for a specific customer. Pagination is supported through optional query parameters.

**URL:** [https://dev-pos-api.zithara.com/v1](https://dev-pos-api.zithara.com/v1)`/customer/order/{PLATFORM_CUSTOMER_ID}`

- `{PLATFORM_CUSTOMER_ID}`: The unique ID of the customer on the platform. **Required.**
    

**Optional Query Parameters:**

| Parameter | Type | Description | Required |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| page | integer | The page number for pagination. | No |
| pageSize | integer | The number of items per page for pagination. | No |

**Response**

## Endpoint

### GET `/v1/transaction`

Retrieves a transaction based on either the internal transaction ID or the platform transaction ID.

**URL:** `https://dev-pos-api.zithara.com/v1/transaction?platformTransactionId=45`

**Query Parameters:**

| Parameter | Type | Description | Required |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| id | string | The internal transaction ID. Use this or `platformTransactionId`. | No |
| platformTransactionId | string | The platform transaction ID. Use this or `id`. | No |

**Response**

### Transaction Details

``` json
{
    "id": "090087d9-9876-4884-b621-7abdafb2b040",
 ```

## Endpoint

**Query Parameters:** (One of these is required)

| Parameter | Type | Description | Required |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| platformCustomerId | string | The unique ID of the customer on the platform. | No |
| email | string | The email address of the customer. | No |
| phone | string | The phone number of the customer. | No |
| customerId | string | The id of the customer. | No |

### Points Information

- **Original Points Left for Customer**: 4096
    

### Earning Points

1. **Sign-Up Points**
    
    - **Points**: 100
        
    - **Expiry**: 45 days
        
2. **Referral Points**
    
    - **Points**: 75
        
    - **Expiry**: 2 months
        
3. **Order-Purchased Points**
    
    - **Points**: 150 per transaction
        
    - **Expiry**: 1 year
        
4. **Media Points**
    
    - **Points**: 50
        
    - **Expiry**: No expiry
        

## Redeeming Points

### Redemption Rules

- **Maximum Limit**:
    
    - If `is_max_limit` is `false`, the user can redeem as many points as they want.
        
    - If `is_max_limit` is `true`, the user can redeem points up to a certain limit.
        
- **Minimum Limit**:
    
    - If `is_min_limit` is `false`, the user can redeem as few points as they want.
        
    - If `is_min_limit` is `true`, the user must redeem a minimum amount of points.
        

### Redemption Object

- **Amount**: 2000
    
- **Maximum Redeem Limit**: 3000
    
- **Minimum Redeem Limit**: 1000
    
- **Points**: 1000
    

The customer can redeem `x` amount for `y` points as specified in the `redeem` object.

## Adding Points

### Rules for Adding Points

1. **Amount â‰¤ 500**:
    
    - **Points Added**: 50
        
2. **Amount > 2000 and â‰¤ 5000**:
    
    - **Points Added**: 12% of the amount
        
3. **Amount > 5000**:
    
    - **Points Added**: Equal to the amount

# add loyalty points

## Endpoint

### POST `/v1/loyalty-points`

### Completes the redemption of loyalty points for a customer.

**URL:** [https://dev-pos-api.zithara.com/v1](https://dev-pos-api.zithara.com/v1)`/loyalty-points`

NOTE: amount is required in the body if the action is order_purchased

actions-accepted - `signed_up`,`referral,order_purchased`

**Response**

``` json
{
    "message": "added points",
    "result": {
        "success": true,
        "data": {
            "transaction": {
                "created_at": "2024-06-26T10:10:38.265Z",
                "updated_at": "2024-06-26T10:10:38.316Z",
                "id": "a8655db2-8c9e-4b8b-ad1c-12efac81ca2e",
                "customer_id": "134025",
                "merchant_id": "35221b02-c600-46f7-bcab-549f399c2a8d",
                "points": 50,
                "used_points": 0,
                "remaining_points": 50,
                "action": "order_purchased",
                "expiry_time": "2024-06-26T10:10:38.264Z",
                "status": "not_used"
            }
        }
    }
}

 ```

## Endpoint

### POST `/v1/initiate-redemption`

Initiates the redemption of loyalty points for a customer.

**URL:** `https://dev-pos-api.zithara.com/v1/initiate-redemption`

## Request Body

The request body must be a JSON object with the following structure:

| Field | Type | Description | Required |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| points | integer | The number of points to redeem. | Yes |
| customer_id | integer | The internal customer ID. | No |
| platform_customer_id | string | The unique ID of the customer on the platform. | No |
| phone_number | string | The phone number of the customer. | No |
| email | string | The email address of the customer. | No |

**Note:** One of `id`, `platform_customer_id`, `phone_number`, or `email` must be provided along with `points`.

### Example Request Body

``` json
{
    "points": 5,
    "id": 1
}

 ```

### Response Body

``` json
{
    "success": true,
    "data": {
        "message": "OTP sent successfully",
        "sentTo": "919398856866"
    },
    "status": 200
}

 ```

This JSON represents the response body indicating that an OTP (One-Time Password) was sent successfully to the phone number "919398856866". The status code is 200, indicating a successful operation.

## Endpoint

### POST `/v1/complete-redemption`

Completes the redemption of loyalty points for a customer.

**URL:** `http://localhost:3000/v1/complete-redemption`

## Request Body

The request body must be a JSON object with the following structure:

| Field | Type | Description | Required |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| customer_id | integer | The internal customer ID. | No |
| platform_customer_id | string | The unique ID of the customer on the platform. | No |
| phone_number | string | The phone number of the customer. | No |
| email | string | The email address of the customer. | No |
| otp | string | The OTP for redemption verification. | Yes |
| points | integer | The number of points to redeem. | Yes |

**Note:** One of `id`, `platform_customer_id`, `phone_number`, or `email` must be provided along with `otp` and `points`.

### Example Request Body

``` json
{
    "customer_id": 1,
    "otp": "599426",
    "points": 5
}

 ```

### Response Body

``` json
{
    "success": true,
    "data": {
        "amount": 2000
    },
    "status": 200
}

 ```

This JSON represents the response body indicating a successful response with an amount of 2000. The status code is 200, indicating a successful operation.

The request body must be a JSON object with the following structure:

| Field | Type | Description | Required |

| platform_cart_item_id | string | The unique ID of the cart item on the platform. | Yes |
| price | float | The updated price of the cart item. | Yes |

| quantity | float | The updated quantity of the cart item. | Yes |

``` json
{
    "platform_cart_item_id": "16189838",
    "price": 778.0,
    "product_id": 2302,
    "quantity": 1.0
}
 ```
